00281 enum os_process_type {

00287     OS_PROCESS_TYPE_TASK = 1,
00290     OS_PROCESS_TYPE_INTERRUPT = 2,
00293     OS_PROCESS_TYPE_EVENT = 3,

00386 void os_yield(void);

00393 static inline void os_start(uint32_t ref_hz) {
00394     extern void os_setup_scheduler(uint32_t);
00395 #if CONFIG_OS_SCHEDULER_TYPE != CONFIG_OS_SCHEDULER_COOPERATIVE
00396     // Setup the scheduler
00397     os_setup_scheduler(ref_hz);
00398 #endif
00399     // Launch the scheduler
00400     os_yield();
00401     // Idle loop
00402     while (true) {
00403         if (!os_event_scheduler()) {
00404             HOOK_OS_IDLE();
00405         }
00406     }
00407 }

00445 static inline bool os_process_is_application(struct os_process *proc) {
00446     extern struct os_process os_app;
00447     return (proc == &os_app);
00448 }

00455 static inline bool os_process_is_task(struct os_process *proc) {
00456     return (proc->type == OS_PROCESS_TYPE_TASK);

00465     return (proc->type == OS_PROCESS_TYPE_INTERRUPT);

00473 static inline bool os_process_is_event(struct os_process *proc) {
00474     return (proc->type == OS_PROCESS_TYPE_EVENT);

00484 static inline void os_process_set_priority(struct os_process *proc, enum os_priority priority) {
00485     // Not critical so no need to use the os_enter_critical function
00486     proc->priority = priority;
00487     proc->priority_counter = priority;
00488 }
00495 static inline enum os_priority os_process_get_priority(struct os_process *proc) {
00496     return proc->priority_counter;
00497 }

00594 static inline struct os_process *os_switch_context_int_handler_hook(void) {
00595 #if CONFIG_OS_USE_TICK_COUNTER == true
00596     extern volatile os_tick_t tick_counter;
00597     // Update the tick counter
00598     tick_counter++;
00599 #endif
00600 #if CONFIG_OS_DEBUG == true
00601     HOOK_OS_DEBUG_TICK();
00602 #endif
00603     HOOK_OS_TICK();
00604     // Task switch context
00605     return os_scheduler();
00606 }
00607 
00613 static inline struct os_process *os_switch_context_hook(void) {
00614 #ifdef OS_SCHEDULER_POST_INTERRUPT_HOOK
00615     // Clear the software interrupt if needed
00616     OS_SCHEDULER_POST_INTERRUPT_HOOK();
00617 #endif
00618 #ifdef OS_SCHEDULER_POST_EVENT_HOOK
00619     // Use the alternate task if any
00620     OS_SCHEDULER_POST_EVENT_HOOK();
00621 #endif
00622     // Task switch context
00623     return os_scheduler();
00624 }
00625 
00639 static inline struct os_process *__os_process_get_application(void) {
00640     extern struct os_process os_app;
00641     return &os_app;
00642 }
00645 static inline void __os_process_application_enable(void) {
00646     extern struct os_process os_app;
00647     os_process_enable(&os_app);
00648     os_app.type = OS_PROCESS_TYPE_APPLICATION;
00649 }
00652 static inline void __os_process_application_disable(void) {
00653     extern struct os_process os_app;
00654     os_process_disable(&os_app);
00655 }
00660 static inline void __os_process_event_enable(void) {
00661     extern struct os_process os_app;
00662     __os_process_application_enable();
00663     os_app.type = OS_PROCESS_TYPE_EVENT;
00664 }
00669 static inline void __os_process_event_disable(void) {
00670     __os_process_application_disable();
00671 }
00672 
00678 void __os_process_enable(struct os_process *proc);
00684 void __os_process_disable(struct os_process *proc);
